availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander C. Stewart (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Stewart and Catherine Stewart. Married to Lucy Bush Stewart in Todd County, Kentucky, in May 1856. Father of Charles Bush Stewart. Attended school in Todd County in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Todd County in 1850. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1860. Farmer in Clark County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2, p. 253B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 756.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 23.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Precinct 5, p. 106B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Clark County, KY, July 1863, p. 23.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994056, Todd County Marriages.
"Alex C. Stewart (1835-1887)," Find A Grave, Memorial 43810227, accessed November 6, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43810227.
